channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: It's supposed to be payday for many federal workers. Instead, they're getting nothing
item.description: Roughly 1.4 million federal workers are going without pay due to the government shutdown. About half of them are furloughed, while the other half has been deemed essential and is working without pay.
item.content:encoded:
Roughly 1.4 million federal workers are going without pay due to the government shutdown. About half of them are furloughed, while the other half has been deemed essential and is working without pay.

(Image credit: Tyrone Turner/WAMU)
item.dc:creator: Jenny Abamu

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Thousands of federal workers miss Friday paychecks as government shutdown drags on, more than 30 arrested, including NBA stars, in FBI's illegal gambling probe, Russians play down President Trump's new sanctions.
item.content:encoded: Thousands of federal workers miss Friday paychecks as government shutdown drags on, more than 30 arrested, including NBA stars, in FBI's illegal gambling probe, Russians play down President Trump's new sanctions.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Maryland Democratic Senator Chris Van Hollen on the stalemate in Congress
item.description: Democratic Sen. Chris Van Hollen of Maryland introduced a bill that would have paid all federal workers. It didn't pass. NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks to Van Hollen about the stalemate in Congress.
item.content:encoded: Democratic Sen. Chris Van Hollen of Maryland introduced a bill that would have paid all federal workers. It didn't pass. NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks to Van Hollen about the stalemate in Congress.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Air traffic control trainees brace for impact of government shutdown
item.description: The FAA's training academy in Oklahoma City is operating in spite of the government shutdown, but air traffic control trainees are still feeling its impact.
item.content:encoded: The FAA's training academy in Oklahoma City is operating in spite of the government shutdown, but air traffic control trainees are still feeling its impact.
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Trump pardons jailed Binance founder who supported Trump family crypto business
item.description: President Trump's pardon for the founder of the cryptocurrency exchange Binance erases one of the government's most significant crackdowns on crypto crime.
item.content:encoded: President Trump's pardon for the founder of the cryptocurrency exchange Binance erases one of the government's most significant crackdowns on crypto crime.
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Chicago South Shore building residents recount 'humiliating' ICE raid
item.description: A federal judge in Chicago is weighing whether federal immigration agents have used appropriate force in recent enforcement efforts. NPR reports on a residential building raid that's become a symbol of these new, and harsher tactics.
item.content:encoded: A federal judge in Chicago is weighing whether federal immigration agents have used appropriate force in recent enforcement efforts. NPR reports on a residential building raid that's become a symbol of these new, and harsher tactics.
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: Russians play down Trump's new sanctions
item.description: President Trump imposed new sanctions on Russia and cancelled a summit with President Putin, hoping to pressure Moscow to agree to a ceasefire in Ukraine. But Putin appears not too concerned.
item.content:encoded: President Trump imposed new sanctions on Russia and cancelled a summit with President Putin, hoping to pressure Moscow to agree to a ceasefire in Ukraine. But Putin appears not too concerned.
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes

item.title: Life in Gaza City after two weeks of ceasefire
item.description: Life is slowly returning to Gaza City in the ceasefire, even as many worry war could return.
item.content:encoded: Life is slowly returning to Gaza City in the ceasefire, even as many worry war could return.
item.dc:creator: Anas Baba

item.title: Cost of Living: Frightening Halloween candy costs
item.description: Federal data shows the price of chewing gum and candy are going up more than eight percent from a year ago. How do the price hikes affect this Halloween season?
item.content:encoded: Federal data shows the price of chewing gum and candy are going up more than eight percent from a year ago. How do the price hikes affect this Halloween season?
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: Conspiracy theorists fuel 'Bugonia' climate horror
item.description: In their fourth feature film collaboration, Yorgos Lanthimos directs actress Emma Stone in Bugonia. The central question at the heart of the film: is she or is she not an alien?
item.content:encoded:
Bugonia. The film marks Stone's fourth feature with Lanthimos.'/>

In their fourth feature film collaboration, Yorgos Lanthimos directs actress Emma Stone in Bugonia. The central question at the heart of the film: is she or is she not an alien?

(Image credit: Atsushi Nishijima)
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel
